definitions.definition: The highest or uppermost part of something.
definitions.example: His kite got caught at the top of the tree.

definitions.definition: A child’s spinning toy; a spinning top.
definitions.example: The boy was amazed at how long the top would spin.

definitions.definition: (heading) Someone who is eminent.
(BDSM) A dominant partner in a BDSM relationship or roleplay.
A man penetrating or with a preference for penetrating during homosexual intercourse.
definitions.example: I prefer being a top, and my boyfriend prefers being a bottom.

definitions.definition: A top quark.
The utmost degree; the acme; the summit.
(ropemaking) A plug, or conical block of wood, with longitudinal grooves on its surface, in which the strands of the rope slide in the process of twisting.
(sound) Highest pitch or loudest volume.
definitions.example: She sang at the top of her voice.

definitions.definition: (wool manufacture) A bundle or ball of slivers of combed wool, from which the noils, or dust, have been taken out.
(obsolete, except in one sense of phrase on top of) Eve; verge; point.
The part of a cut gem between the girdle, or circumference, and the table, or flat upper surface.
(in the plural) Topboots.
A stroke on the top of the ball.
A forward spin given to the ball by hitting it on or near the top.
(in restaurants, preceded by a number) (A table at which there is, or which has enough seats for) a group of a specified number of people eating at a restaurant.
To cover on the top or with a top.
definitions.example: I like my ice cream topped with chocolate sauce.

definitions.definition: To cut or remove the top (as of a tree)
definitions.example: I don't want to be bald, so just top my hair.

definitions.definition: To excel, to surpass, to beat.
definitions.example: Titanic was the most successful film ever until it was topped by another Cameron film, Avatar.

definitions.definition: To be in the lead, to be at number one position (of).
definitions.example: Celine Dion topped the UK music charts twice in the 1990s.

definitions.definition: To commit suicide.
definitions.example: Depression causes many people to top themselves.

definitions.definition: To murder.
(BDSM) To be the dominant partner in a BDSM relationship or roleplay.
definitions.example: Giving advice to the dominant partner on how to run the BDSM session is called "topping from the bottom".

definitions.definition: (gay sexuality) To be the partner who penetrates in anal sex.
(gay sexuality) To anally penetrate.
To rise aloft; to be eminent; to tower.
definitions.example: lofty ridges and topping mountains

definitions.definition: To predominate.
definitions.example: topping passions

definitions.definition: To excel; to rise above others.
To raise one end of (a yard, etc.), making it higher than the other.
(dyeing) To cover with another dye.
definitions.example: to top aniline black with methyl violet to prevent greening

definitions.definition: To put a stiffening piece or back on (a saw blade).
To arrange (fruit, etc.) with the best on top.
(of a horse) To strike the top of (an obstacle) with the hind feet while jumping, so as to gain new impetus.
To improve (domestic animals, especially sheep) by crossing certain individuals or breeds with other superior breeds.
To cut, break, or otherwise take off the top of (a steel ingot) to remove unsound metal.
To strike (the ball) above the centre; also, to make (a stroke, etc.) by hitting the ball in this way.
Situated on the top of something.
Best; of the highest quality or rank.
definitions.example: She's in the top dance school.

definitions.definition: Very good, of high quality, power, or rank.
definitions.example: He's a top lawyer.

definitions.definition: Rated first.
definitions.example: She came top in her French exam.

definitions.definition: The smallest unit of language that has a particular meaning and can be expressed by itself; the smallest discrete, meaningful unit of language. (contrast morpheme.)
Something like such a unit of language:
The fact or act of speaking, as opposed to taking action. .
Something that someone said; a comment, utterance; speech.
A watchword or rallying cry, a verbal signal (even when consisting of multiple words).
definitions.example: mum's the word

definitions.definition: A proverb or motto.
News; tidings (used without an article).
definitions.example: Have you had any word from John yet?

definitions.definition: An order; a request or instruction; an expression of will.
definitions.example: Don't fire till I give the word

definitions.definition: A promise; an oath or guarantee.
definitions.example: I give you my word that I will be there on time.

definitions.definition: A brief discussion or conversation.
definitions.example: Can I have a word with you?

definitions.definition: (in the plural) See words.
definitions.example: There had been words between him and the secretary about the outcome of the meeting.

definitions.definition: (sometimes Word) Communication from God; the message of the Christian gospel; the Bible, Scripture.
definitions.example: Her parents had lived in Botswana, spreading the word among the tribespeople.

definitions.definition: (sometimes Word) Logos, Christ.
To say or write (something) using particular words; to phrase (something).
definitions.example: I’m not sure how to word this letter to the council.

definitions.definition: To flatter with words, to cajole.
To ply or overpower with words.
To conjure with a word.
To speak, to use words; to converse, to discourse.
Truth, indeed, that is the truth! The shortened form of the statement "My word is my bond."
definitions.example: "Yo, that movie was epic!" / "Word?" ("You speak the truth?") / "Word." ("I speak the truth.")

definitions.definition: (stereotypically) An abbreviated form of word up; a statement of the acknowledgment of fact with a hint of nonchalant approval.
(except in set phrases) To be, become, betide.
definitions.example: Well worth thee, me friend.

definitions.definition: "Hello!" or an equivalent greeting.
To greet with "hello".
A greeting (salutation) said when meeting someone or acknowledging someone’s arrival or presence.
definitions.example: Hello, everyone.

definitions.definition: A greeting used when answering the telephone.
definitions.example: Hello? How may I help you?

definitions.definition: A call for response if it is not clear if anyone is present or listening, or if a telephone conversation may have been disconnected.
definitions.example: Hello? Is anyone there?

definitions.definition: Used sarcastically to imply that the person addressed or referred to has done something the speaker or writer considers to be foolish.
definitions.example: You just tried to start your car with your cell phone. Hello?

definitions.definition: An expression of puzzlement or discovery.
definitions.example: Hello! What’s going on here?

definitions.definition: To welcome in a friendly manner, either in person or through another means e.g. writing or over the phone/internet
To arrive at or reach, or meet (talking of something which brings joy)
To accost; to address.
To meet and give salutations.
To be perceived by (somebody).
definitions.example: A brilliant dawn greeted her eyes as she looked out of the window.

definitions.definition: To weep; to cry.
A conventional phrase used to start a letter or conversation or otherwise to acknowledge a person's arrival or presence.
definitions.example: It's polite to begin a letter with a greeting, but this practice is less common in email.

definitions.definition: The action of the verb to greet.
